questions.question: Question 1: What is the definition of ergonomics?

options.a: Fitting the job to the worker
options.c: Process of improving industrial safety standards
options.d: Prevention of health problems of factory workers

questions.explanation:
Ergonomics is defined as fitting the job to the worker. The aim of ergonomics is to achieve the 
best mutual adjustment of man and his work, for the improvement of human efficacy and 
well-being. Emporiatrics, also called travel medicine, deals with the prevention and management of health 
problems of international travelers.

questions.question: Question 2: Who is the Chairman of ESI corporation in India?

options.b: Union Minister of Health & Family Welfare
options.d: Union Minister of Human Resources Development

questions.explanation:
The Union Minister of Labour is the Chairman of the Employees' State Insurance Corporation 
(ESIC) in India. The Secretary to the Ministry of Labour is the Vice-Chairman of ESIC.

questions.question: Question 5: Which of the following is true about Factories Act?

options.a: Children under 14 years of age must not be employed in factories
options.b: A child of 16 years can be employed only between 6 AM and 8 PM
options.c: The maximum working hours for an adult is 72 hours per week
options.d: A child of 16 years can work till 5 hours per day

questions.explanation:
Factories act prohibits children of <14 years from being employed. Children between 15–18 years can be employed only in certain industries and work only between 6 
AM–7 PM. They should not be made to work for more than four and a half hours. The maximum working hours for an adult industrial worker should be not more than 48 hours 
per week, not exceeding 9 hours a day; if overtime is paid, then it should be not more than 60 hrs 
per week.

questions.question:
Question 6: What is the maximum daily working hours for an adolescent employee, according to the 
Factories Act of 1948?
questions.explanation:
According to the Factories Act of 1948, adolescents should not be made to work for more than 
four and a half hours a day.

questions.question:
Question 7: According to Factories Act of 1948, a welfare officer has to be employed if the number of 
employees is:
questions.explanation:
A welfare officer has to be employed if the number of employees is > 500 according to the 
Factories Act of 1948. According to the Factories Act, safety and welfare measures include the provision of the following: • > 1000 employees – Safety Officer • > 500 employees – Welfare Officer • > 250 employees – Canteen • > 50 employees - Crèche

questions.question: Question 8: Which of the following establishments is covered by the Employees' State Insurance Act?
questions.explanation:
Currently, private medical and educational institutes employing >20 people are covered under 
the ESI Act. The ESI Act is applicable to all industries except: • Defence • Railway • Mines 707

questions.question: Question 9: What percentage of the total wage bill is contributed by the employer under the ESI Act?
questions.explanation:
The employer contributes 3.25% of the total wage bill under the ESI Act. The government has revised the rates of ESI contribution by employers (from 4.75% to 3.25%) 
and employees (from 1.75% to 0.75%) in 2019. The distribution of the financial contribution is given below: • Employee: 0.75% of the total wage bill • Employer: 3.25% of the total wage bill • Medical benefit: 1/8th by the state government and 7/8th by the central government

questions.question: Question 10: Under the ESI Act, which of the following is not given as a cash benefit?
questions.explanation:
Under the ESI Act, medical benefit is not given as a cash benefit. It is provided in the form of 
consultations, investigations and treatment by means of the ESI hospitals or ESI dispensaries.

questions.question: Question 11: What is enhanced sickness benefit?

options.a: Benefit given at 70% of the wage for 91 days
options.b: Benefit given at 80% of the wage for 120 days
options.c: Benefit given for a duration of 2 years for 34 specified diseases
options.d: Benefit given at full wages for undergoing sterilization procedure

questions.explanation:
Enhanced sickness benefit under the ESI Act is the benefit given at full wages for undergoing 
sterilization procedures. Under the ESI Act, sickness benefit is given at 70% of the daily wage for a duration of 91 days in 
one year. There are two special types of sickness benefits given: • Enhanced sickness benefit: Benefit given at full wages for sterilization procedures; for a duration 
of 7 days post-vasectomy and 14 days post-tubectomy. • Extended sickness benefit: Benefit given for a duration of 2 years for 34 specified diseases.

questions.question: Question 12: Which of the following is not a benefit given under the ESI Act?
questions.explanation:
Welfare benefit is not given under the ESI act. The following benefits are given under the ESI act: • Medical benefit • Sickness benefit • Maternity benefit • Dependance benefit • Disablement benefit • Funeral benefit • Rehabilitation benefit 708

questions.question: Question 13: An employee diagnosed with TB gets extended sickness benefit for:
questions.explanation: Extended sickness benefit is given for a period of 2 years.

questions.question: Question 14: Which of the following statements is true about ESI Act?

options.b: State government covers 1/8th and ESI corporation covers 7/8th of the cost of medical care
options.c: Maternity benefit is payable at full wages for upto 24 weeks
options.d: It covers all employees getting income up to Rs.18,000/- per month

questions.explanation:
The state government's share of expenditure on medical care is 1/8th, and the ESI corporation's 
share of expenditure on medical care is 7/8th of the total cost. Few important points about the ESI Act: • It covers all employees getting income up to Rs.21,000/- per month. • The employer contributes 3.25% of the total wage bill. • An employee contributes 0.75% of wages. • State and Central government share medical expenditure in the ratio 1:7. • Medical benefit: Full medical care • Sickness benefit: 70% of the average daily wages and is payable for 91 days. • Extended sickness benefit: Payable for 2 years for a set of 34 diseases. • Enhanced sickness benefit: Full average daily wage for a duration up to 7 days in case of 
vasectomy and up to 14 days in case of tubectomy. • Maternity benefit: Full average daily wage for a duration up to 26 weeks (confinement) or 6 
weeks (miscarriage/MTP) or 4 weeks (sickness arising out of pregnancy). • Funeral expenses: Cash not exceeding Rs.15,000.

questions.question: Question 15: Who is the beneficiary under the Rajiv Gandhi Shramik Kalyan Yojana scheme of ESI?

options.a: It has increased influence only in below-average educated population
options.b: It gives greater support for concentrated programmes
options.c: Mass media alone is inadequate in changing human behavior

questions.explanation:
Rajiv Gandhi Shramik Kalyan Yojana (RGSKY) is a scheme of ESI that benefits an insured person 
rendered unemployed, involuntarily. Unemployment allowance under RGSKY is given when an insured person is going out of 
employment involuntarily, on account of: • Closure of a factory or establishment • Retrenchment (laying off employees due to economic difficulty) • Permanent disability due to nonemployment injury Allowance and eligibility criteria of Rajiv Gandhi Shramik Kalyan Yojana (updated in 2019): • The allowance is given at the rate of 50% of the daily wage for a maximum of 2 years. • To qualify for the scheme the worker must have worked in that setup for more than 3 years. 709

person, in cases where death occurs due to employment injury or occupational hazards. 710
